question: In the following scheme of reaction,
images/2024-chem-18-1.png
X, Y and Z respectively are: [cite: 132-144]
choices: HF, aqueous KOH and Na in dry ether
<katex>$Hg_{2}F_{2}$</katex>, alcoholic KOH and Na in dry ether
explanation: X: Swarts reaction uses <katex>$Hg_2F_2$</katex> to convert alkyl chloride to fluoride. Y: Alcoholic KOH causes dehydrohalogenation to form ethene. Z: Wurtz reaction with Na in dry ether forms butane. [cite: 146, 147]
